Articles.Content:
Floor Sixteen thousand, twenty six:

Nothing to report, nothing to see here (Its a model of the VAB with no rocket because thats the message it has!)

Floor sixteen thousand and twenty seven:

A scantily clad green lady is trying to sell you locomotive insurance from a booth.

Edited April 27, 2017 by GregroxMun

Floor 1628

Hey look, and elevator! Wait, no. That's a cardboard box that says "Ride Me!"

Floorsixteen thousand and twenty nine:

look at my dog!
Sqr(2656900):  Massachusetts Bay Colony outlaws the possession of playing cards, dice, and gaming tables.

at this stage wich have/has/had a number whatsoever:

here you just have 11 000 years to go ^^

Edited April 27, 2017 by WinkAllKerb''

Floor 1631:

something is here, I think, not quite sure...so bad and sad and glad and mad

OH NO!!! ITS THE RHYMING FLOOR!! AAAAAAAAAH!!!

floor 1632:

floor 1633 (a floor in a floor)

Floor 1634: you realize that you don't remember whether you've been taking the stairs or the elevator. You also realize that you still have a long way to go because of the model of the building that goes up to the ceiling from the floor, and doesn't seem to stop there.
Floor 1635: Lights flicker on and off, and you feel as though something else is there. Looking around, you see nothing. You step towards the stairs...
Floor 1636: You notice that the window has cracks in it. You hurry to the next floor before it fails and blows out.

Floor 1637

there is two doors a left one and a right one which one do you choose?

Spoiler

Left door: floor 1638

right door: floor 1639 (go to jail square) do not pass go or collect any money during that time
Left door: Floor 1638: you find a police station. Strange that it's so far above the ground.

Floor 1639.

You take a moment to reorient yourself, then find the elevator. It has only two buttons: Ground floor and 1640. Odd, but you've seen stranger things on this building.

I push "Ground", but due to a short in the panel I arrive at 1640 regardless.

1640: nothing but a darkened stairwell leading up; a pair of glowing blue eyes stares in your direction from the floor above...
1641 floor- it is just a copy of the first floor. You wonder: But what if I walked such a long way but in the end I am arriving at its start?
1642: you realize that, though you can't describe this floor, it is definitely not the same as the second floor.
1643:  ...and although this looks eerily similar to the third floor, that tiger in the corner appears hungry...and he's looking at you!
1644: you find humans playing with liquid fuel boosters. You also have a strange sense of deja vu.
Floor 1645: Welcome to Joe's! Deja vu intensifies.
Floor 1646: you see a rocket flying at you, and duck as it almost hits you. You hurry up the stairs and hope nothing bad is waiting for you on the next floor.
Floor 1647: Mike, Sully and Boo (from monsters inc) and a random door, you go through the door more stairs, great
Floor 1648: The stairs abruptly end with an elevator. Great.
Floor 1649: You see a sign for "upper atmosphere bungee jumping".
Floor 1650: an SSTO crashes through the windows, taking you to floor 1651.
